headshotImage.longCaption: Gavin Larsen player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: prodded into the covers, and so ends the resumption of hostilities between NZ and Bangladesh after a 9 year break

commentPostTextItems.html: and as far as thrashings go, that was highly enjoyable
NZ did their best to give the tailenders some batting practice, but they didnt quite get there
and so ends the 1st rounds of matches, Zimbabwe on top of Group A, NZ on top of Group B, no doubt some mud is to settle there.
Tomorrow we head back to Group A, with England to take on Kenya, a match which could send the world cup onto the front page of the english dailies, that is, if Kenya win
President Gavin Larsen is the Man of the Match
an impeccable display of slow straight bowling at the stumps
so until tomorrow, it's good evening from CI

commentTextItems.html: guided thru the covers, the chasing fieldsman just doesn't have the stamina to keep up
poked on the off side, trickles away
pushed easily into the off side
careful defence, back to the bowler
gets frustrated, goes for a cut, not timed or placed, just over the covers and into the deep

commentPostTextItems.html: 7 to go, nearly there, can NZ hang on

milestones.description: Hasibul Hossain has broken the record for most sixes (4) in ODIs for BAN, going past Habibul Bashar's 3
This is the lowest match aggregate (233) involving teams New Zealand & Bangladesh in ODIs
Akram Khan has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (27) for BAN, going past Aminul Islam
